column4: Installing Ubuntu 7 on Toshiba Satellite Laptop Celeron M 1.4ghz.  512mb ram.  Alternat Text instal.  Fails at "slecting and installing software" 6%.  Any suggestions?
are you sure its failing?  or does it just seemt o freeze, the alt. install takes a long time at that step
are you getting a big red screen indicating the install has failed?
usually if i get a failure i just keep repeating till it works, i've never had to do it more than twice
hmm, dont know...
are you trying 7.04 or 7.10
dont' know, how fast are you burning the disks?.. slower the better, adn it does make a difference
what type of media, and how fast are you burning?
i asked you a question several minutes ago and you didn't respond.
then you need to prefix talking tom e with my name, i'm not gonna stare at the screen waiting on you to respond
so what type of media are you using, how fast are you burning, etc.
try slowing downt he burn speed, 2-4x is best
wel,l you obviously know everything, but let me tell you, you're wrong

either media related, burn related, or something else.

try disabling apci, but i doubt that will fix it.
